Title: Wilms Tumor
ProbableCases: A 3 year old child presented with a **unilateral, large abdominal mass** which extend down the pelvis. Histology show **sheets of blue cells**.

Title: Homer Wright Pseudo Rosettes (Neuroblastoma Histology)
ProbableCases: A 2 year old child presented with a **large abdominal mass** and **weight loss**. He has **deep bluish discolouration of skin (Blueberry Muffin Baby)**. Blood - **Elevated levels of VMA (Vanillyl mandellic acid)**.

Title: Cystic Fibrosis
ProbableCases: A 10 year old child is hospitalized with **pneumonia** and **difficulty in breathing**. His stools are **large** and contains **undigested particles**. His **sweat chloride levels are elevated**.

Title: Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS)
ProbableCases: A 6 month old baby dies **suddenly** with **unexplained** cause even after **proper investigation, autopsy and clinical history**.

Title: Phenylketonuria
ProbableCases: A 6 month old baby has **reduced intellectual ability**. His blood sample shows **elevated levels of phenylalanine**.
